abstract: Editorial asserts that the new rules from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, which will allow millions of underwater borrowers who are current on their payments to refinance their high-rate mortgages into lower-rate loans, is still only a modest fix; urges President Obama to put more pressure on banks to reduce the principal balance for homeowners struggling with these loans.
snippet: New refinancing rules could help millions of homeowners, but more is still needed.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

lead_paragraph: New refinancing rules could help millions of homeowners, but more is still needed.

headline.seo: On the Road to Mortgage Relief
